discussion.author: affeldt-aist
discussion.comment: I am wondering whether the explanation for the naming of the contra lemmas shouldn't go also into the contributing guide at the root of the repo.

discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment:
> I am wondering whether the explanation for the naming of the contra lemmas shouldn't go also into the contributing guide at the root of the repo.

It would be more appropriate in a general documentation of ssrnat/ssrnum I think. It can be done as a new PR though.

discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment:
> LGTM. However, given the large number of largely boring lemmas, I wonder whether it would be possible to introduce a `contra:` tactic that automatically picks the right contra lemma, or even constructs it from the shape of the goal. However, I'm not sure how well that would work with the `comparable_*` lemmas.

I see how we could do this using canonical structures / typeclasses ... but for now, let's keep it like this.

discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment: Please open an issue / feature request with your nice idea  :+1:

commits.author: CohenCyril
commits.message:
Adding contra lemmas with orders

- Adding contra lemmas between `leq`, `ltn`, `Order.le` ("le"),
  `Order.lt` ("lt"), `b` ("T"), `~~ b` ("N"), `b = false` ("F"),
  and `~ P` ("not").
- Changelog for contra lemmas with orders
